topics.body: Well unlike you guys, I got scolded and I have trouble understanding his instructions.

I never took classes to drive a car.
I learned everything for family. 
They teach me how to drive and those things.
More simple, more easy and _free_

topics.body:
Welp. I just saw the comments about the upcoming MLP movie.

!http://media.tumblr.com/tumblr_m46hsaFoL41qb9xkb.gif!

I was expecting people to be excited. Man was I wrong. People have been asking for an MLP movie and when one's announced...they just say it's gonna be shit right off the bat?

I honestly don't get it. What am I missing here?

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54e94b206368721adad40200#post_54e94b206368721adad40200
When my dad teaches it, it feels more natural. I feel calmer and my movements are more fluid.

When he teaches, it kinda scares me and he usually mumbles words I don't understand. He's a bit strict too.

Also, there's a kid throwing a tantrum next to me.

But yeah, cautiously hyped.

Normally, I'd be loath to bring Ben Croshaw (I refuse to dignify him by calling him his other name) into anything, but one quote of his is particularly poignant for this situation:

"Fans are clingy complaining dipshits who will never ever be grateful for any concession you make."
